{"step_by_step_thinking": "Transmission of HIV from mother to child can be prevented by several methods. According to the documents, oral zidovudine to the mother at the 3rd trimester along with oral zidovudine to the infant for 6 weeks is a known method of prevention (Document [11]). Stopping breastfeeding is also a known method of prevention as breastfeeding can transmit the virus from mother to child (Document [17]). Vaginal delivery is not a method of prevention, in fact, it can increase the risk of transmission (Document [22]). There is no mention of Vitamin A prophylaxis to the mother as a method of prevention in the documents.", "answer_choice": "B. Vitamin A prophylaxis to mother"}
